meanings.definition: Photosystems: clusters of pigments and proteins in plant cells that capture light energy for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent1: The photosystems in the plant cells help capture light energy for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photosystems to understand how plants convert light energy into chemical energy.
meanings.sent3: The photosystems in the plant cells were having a party, capturing light energy for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent4: The photosystems worked together like a team of superheroes, capturing light energy to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the photosystems made them stand out in the green sea of plant cells.

meanings.definition: Photosystems: the process by which plants and other organisms convert light energy into chemical energy.
meanings.sent1: During photosynthesis, photosystems help plants convert light energy into chemical energy.
meanings.sent2: Learning about photosystems is essential to understanding how plants produce energy from sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photosystems were on a mission to convert light energy into chemical energy, making them the heroes of the plant world.
meanings.sent4: The photosystems worked tirelessly, transforming light energy into chemical energy like alchemists of the plant kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The photosystems danced with light, turning it into the fuel that powers all life on Earth.
